parameter.name: hdfs.url
parameter.description: The URL to access HDFS service via its protocol. Typically this is the fs.defaultFS property in the core-site.xml configuration file. For example: hdfs://hdfs.namenode.host:8020.

parameter.name: yarn.rm.url
parameter.description: The URL to the YARN ResourceManager, used to provide YARN Application data. For example: http://yarn.resourcemanager.host:8050

parameter.name: yarn.rm.webapp.url
parameter.description: The URL to the YARN ResourceManager Web Application, used to provide YARN UI. Typically this is the yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.address config from yarn-site.xml configuration file. For example: http://yarn.resourcemanager.host:8088

parameter.name: yarn.rm.scheduler.url
parameter.description: The URL to the YARN ResourceManager Scheduler, which schedules YARN Applications. For example: http://yarn.resourcemanager.host:8030

parameter.name: zookeeper.quorum
parameter.description: ZooKeeper quorum location. Typically this is a comma separated list of ZooKeeper hostnames and port numbers (clientPort property in the zookeeper-env). For example: zookeeper.host1:2181,zookeeper.host2:2181.

parameter.name: ganglia.server.hostname
parameter.description: Hostname where Ganglia Server is located

parameter.name: ganglia.additional.clusters
parameter.description: Ganglia clusters which can be used by applications created in Slider Apps view. Value is comma separated list of cluster-name and port pairs. Typically this is the additional_clusters in the ganglia-env configuration. For example: Application1:8881,Application2:8882

parameter.name: slider.security.enabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether cluster has been secured or not.

parameter.name: yarn.rm.kerberos.principal
parameter.description: Kerberos principal used to access YARN ResourceManager. For example: rm/_HOST@EXAMPLE.COM

parameter.name: dfs.namenode.kerberos.principal
parameter.description: Kerberos principal used to access HDFS NameNode. For example: nn/_HOST@EXAMPLE.COM

parameter.name: view.kerberos.principal
parameter.description: Kerberos principal associated with this view. For example: ambari/_HOST@EXAMPLE.COM

parameter.name: view.kerberos.principal.keytab
parameter.description: Path to the Kerberos principal keytab used for view's user. For example: /etc/security/keytabs/ambari.headless.keytab
